text: 3:27 Welcome !
author: Octinion

text: Really nice towards the end. Not bad all the way through though :s.
author: greenyxi

text: 3:30 - the reason I can't stop playing.
author: Michael James

text:
+Michael James I wish I couldn't stop playing, but FTL stresses me out so much that I end up feeling worse after I play it than before xD. It's an great game with an awesome soundtrack, its just too stressful for me to handle.

I can't deal with rougelike games for some reason, they're too fast-paced and don't give you a break. Except for Pokemon Mystery dungeon.
author: Darticus the Great

text: How can you play so many games? That is just impossible :o
author: SurviveZ

text: Roguelikes are like this : you basically need some luck to be able to beat them! The gameplay of FTL is very interesting though!

author: bladesofseven

text: I think 3:27 is EVERYONE's favourite part
author: OTfor22

text: I gotta say thqt people greatly exaggerate the role of luck in this game, after around 100 hours of playing, i manage to win about 5 out of 7 games. What people don't get is that it takes a lot of experience just to improve slightly. Still havent gotten that crystal ship though ^.^
author: 12kwh

text: My main problem with the game is that the first three sectors are relatively simple (unless you get unlucky), and then the first ship you meet in Sector 4 is just a brick wall that obliterates you.
author: vyse19861

text:
I really love all the music this game plays to my ears. 

Especially Engi (Battle) one. It hits you with melancholy after the first minute.

text: I like it when it start at 3:28
author: Cloud

text: Very cool song with a surprising 2nd part.
author: CleverDjembe

text: Thank you so much for uploading a track! I'm hoping maybe for a track from the civilian sector?
author: Lorde Sinclair

text: I have played this some and though I don't really like rougelikes, I like this game's style.  I almost beat it in fact, it just takes some planning ahead for what you are going for.
author: BygPhattyPlus

text: Getting a lucky break in this game is so integral to beating it that it's absurd at times. Eventually I stopped caring about beating it and just started playing it to casually amuse myself, which was a lot better. Speaking of luck, have you heard what kind of perfect lucky circumstances it takes to get the Crystal Cruiser? It's fucking insane!
author: Krakdown88

text: My personal favorite would be Rockmen (Explore). It's﻿ so damn catchy once it really starts and it always reminds me of the great era of Square-RPGs.
author: Kyo555

text: Also, the final boss music is kickass.
author: Sire Nukerre

text: Gameplay can be frustrating at times, but such is the nature of games with Rogue-like elements. The music never fails to remind you that you're in space and that the nearest civilization is probably light-years apart. The best example that invokes a sense of loneliness is the Engi theme.
author: Sire Nukerre

text: Unlike TBI where you can rely on﻿ your own skill if you're on a run that gives you terrible items, I felt completely powerless in this game when luck just wasn't on my side. I know I'm being quite negative on this game but I still had fun with it, and I realise that most people absolutely love this game (showed up on a lot of 2012 GOTY lists). But yeah, I'd think you guys would rather know my honest opinion. The music? Awesomely atmospheric. 3:27 is my favorite part in this one.
author: SupraDarky

text: I went in without knowing it was a game with the same structure as The Binding of Isaac, I thought there was a big single player campaign. I know it's the main reason why the game can end up being so addictive and can be played for tons of hours, but (incoming personal opinion) I was disappointed. I've already said I'm not a fan of randomly generated structures. The gameplay itself is super satisfying, which is why I'm willing to keep playing it from time to time.
author: SupraDarky
